solution_line_template: For {months_so_far} months, Shara was able to return ${monthly_payment} x {months_so_far} = $<<{monthly_payment}*{months_so_far}={amount_returned}>>{amount_returned} to her brother.
Since she already returned half of the money, then this means she currently owes her brother $<<{amount_returned}={current_debt}>>{current_debt}.
Four months from now, she will be able to pay an additional ${monthly_payment} x {months_future} = $<<{monthly_payment}*{months_future}={future_payment}>>{future_payment}.
Thus, she will still owe her brother ${current_debt} - ${future_payment} = $<<{current_debt}-{future_payment}={remaining_debt}>>{remaining_debt} four months from now.
